_prev_prog_2.FR_Comments: Missouri Code of State Regulations, Title 2 Dept of Ag, Missouri Title 2 CSR 90-11.010, and ANSI Ed
_prev_prog_2.PC_OtherType: Administration controls (operating procedures) in place. Equipment controls in place, remote manual shutoff valve, and in-line excess flow automatic shutdown valves, and loadout riser breakaway system
_prev_prog_2.MD_OtherType: Routine visual inspections by trained operators.
_prev_prog_2.EquipmentTested: storage tanks, piping, compressors, pumps, hoses, valves, and related equipment

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Risk Management Plan-Executive Summary


Facility:     Ray-Carroll County Grain Growers
	      Carrollton, MO 64633
Contact:    David Heddings
Phone:      660-631-0868 

1.     Facility Policy.

        The owners, management and employees of Ray-Carroll County Grain Growers Inc, are committed to the prevention of any accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia.  If an accidental release should occur, the facility is prepared to work with the local fire department, Carroll County LEPC, and/or other authorities, to mitigate and minimize the impacts of the release to the people and the environment.

2.     Facility Information.

        The primary activity at the facility is the distribution of products to farmers.  The fertilizer product, anhydrous ammonia is received, stored and distributed for direct application as a nutrient for crop production.  Anhydrous ammonia is stored in tanks designed for this purpose.

3.	The Worst-Case Release Scenario and the Alternate Release Scenario 

An analysis of the potential off-site consequences of hypothetical worst-case and alternative-case accidental releases have been addressed in our Hazard Assessment and information is in our Risk Management Program.

4.	Accidental Release Prevention Program

        The facility is in compliance with the provisions of the U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA), 29 CFR 1910.111, Storage and handling of anhydrous ammonia and our state regulations covering anhydrous ammonia.  The OSHA standard is referenced in this RMP Registration Form; see Section 8.3 (b).

5.      Five-Year Accident History.

         There have been no accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia in the past five years that have caused any deaths, injuries or significant property damage at the facility; nor to our knowledge, has there been any accidental releases resulting in off-site deaths, injuries, evacuations, property damage, or environmental damage.
6.       Emergency Acti

on Plan.

          The facility has:

           a.     A written emergency action plan, in accordance with OSHA standard 
                   29 CFR 1910.38;

b.     Provided state and local authorities with the emergency planning and 
                   Community right-to-know information as required under SARA Title III (EPCRA);

           c.     If a large release of anhydrous ammonia takes place at the facility, 
                   the required response action is to evacuate the area of the spill and 
                   call 911 and all applicable emergency response numbers listed in our
                   Emergency Action Plan.

7.       Planned Changes to Improve Safety.

          Safety improvement is an on-going process at the facility.  Periodic evaluations are performed to assess the conditions of Ray-Carroll County Grain Growers Inc.  There are no additional specific safety recommendations regarding storage or use of anhydrous ammonia for implementation at this time.
